name: Crabmeat Bisque Made Easy
author: Tammye S Green
summary: This is not a thick soup, yet it is creamy and so smooth to the palette. The aroma when cooking makes you want some before the potatoes are soft. I have made modifications due to allergy to corn (such as rice flour). I allow mine to slow-simmer with lid slightly ajar. Stir often so the film does not form on top. I have doubled my batch and still never have any for the freezer.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
¼ teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste
1 cup seafood stock, or more as needed
directions: Spray a stockpot with cooking spray
Melt butter in the prepared stockpot over medium heat; cook and stir celery, onion, paprika, seafood seasoning, thyme, salt, and white pepper until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes
Whisk flour into vegetable mixture until smooth and dissolved
Pour seafood stock over vegetable mixture
Mix half-and-half, cream, and milk into broth mixture; decrease heat and simmer until bisque is thickened, about 15 minutes
Add crabmeat and simmer bisque until crabmeat is heated through, about 5 minutes more
